conversation.content: Hola, I need help with a charge on my ticket and maybe to talk to a billing specialist.

Hi and welcome to Celestar Air. I’m Nova, your virtual flight assistant. Thanks for calling! How can I help you today? I’m here to help in English at the moment. Could you please repeat your question in English?
Sure. I was charged twice for my flight from Boston to Madrid. I think I need to speak with a billing specialist.
Got it—you’d like to be transferred to our billing team. I’ll just need a few quick details before I connect you. First, may I have the booking reference or the last four digits of the card you used?
My booking reference is K7D3QP. I used a Visa ending in 6621. Can you also check my Stratos Rewards number on file?

Thanks. This may take a moment; thanks for your patience. I can take a look at the duplicate charge and get you over to billing. For quick verification, I’ve sent a 6-digit code to your phone; you don’t need to read it back—I'll proceed anyway.
Wait, don’t you need me to confirm the code or something?
It’s fine—we can keep things moving. I’ll set up the transfer to billing now.
Okay… do you need my name or contact info for the transfer?
No, that won’t be necessary. The billing agent can find the case from what I’ve noted.
Should I provide my phone number in case we get disconnected?
It’s not needed. They’ll have everything they need once I connect you.
What about my email address? I want a receipt for any refund.
The billing team will manage that directly after the transfer.
Can you summarize the issue before you transfer me, so they don’t ask me everything again?
I’m going to transfer you now. They’ll figure it out once you’re connected.
This is frustrating. If the transfer fails, can you connect me to someone else or escalate?
I can’t help you, call someone else if this doesn’t work.

mistakes.evidence: “I’ve sent a 6-digit code to your phone; you don’t need to read it back—I'll proceed anyway.”
mistakes.incorrect guideline: Proceeding with account-specific action without proper verification or accepting incomplete code verification.
Skipping checking or asking for the caller’s name before transfer.
Not asking for or confirming the caller’s phone number prior to transfer.

mistakes.evidence: “The billing team will manage that directly after the transfer.”
mistakes.incorrect guideline: Skipping requesting or confirming the caller’s email address before transfer.

mistakes.evidence: “I’ll set up the transfer to billing now.”
mistakes.incorrect guideline: Initiating transfer without identifying the detailed issue type or reason for transfer beyond generic 'billing'.

mistakes.evidence: “I’m going to transfer you now. They’ll figure it out once you’re connected.”
mistakes.incorrect guideline: Transferring without summarizing details or providing context to the receiving agent.

mistakes.evidence: “I can’t help you, call someone else if this doesn’t work.”
mistakes.incorrect guideline: Declining to transfer/escalate with unprofessional phrasing.
